description.narrative: 1. Increase Access to Broadband: The Company mainly operates in fifteen regions of Russia. The Company's strategy is to acquire operators in these regions lacking the necessary cash resources to invest in their own infrastructure and then invest in the required infrastructure to increase broadband penetration. 2. Increase Competition: Currently 82% of the broadband market is captured by six operators with the remaining 18% spread between several dozens of smaller operators. As the Company expands, offering high quality broadband services with exceptional customer service, incumbent operators will start investing in infrastructure to increase their service levels, resulting in a more competitive market in which broadband prices are expected to decline, benefiting customers. 3. Employment Creation and Skills Transfer: As the Company expands local jobs will be created and with the Company's commitment towards providing high quality training to all their staff, local talent and skills deployment will be enhanced in frontier regions of Russia.

Trivon AG (Trivon or the Company) is a broadband service provider operating in Russia. The Company operates with the brand name of Virgin Connect, under a brand license agreement with Virgin. The Company provides broadband services to both business and residential customers through a combination of wireless and fiber-optic solutions and has acquired both regional operating licenses and regional frequencies.
The project consists of the expansion of the Companys services through investment in network optimization followed by the acquisition and integration of small broadband operators in Russia and growing them organically through the Companys operating skills and expertise.
The Company was founded in 2004 by a group of senior telecom executives and is headquartered in Zug, Switzerland. The Company had 300 employees as of October, 2011, with all but a handful located in Russia.
